comment: Prof. Yi is a really nice guy and his class is hard but if you put in the effort you will succeed. He is willing to help in anyway and always responds to emails quickly. Gives good feedback on papers and goes over reviews for tests with you to help you understand the material. He also has awesome style
Great Teacher, He loves what he dose he is super helpful and will go the extra mile in making sure that you understand what he is teaching if you put in the work. TAKE HIM

Awesome professor, definitely take this guy. His lectures are very interesting and he breaks down difficult concepts to ensure anyone can understand. Majority of the midterm and final were questions from the online textbook quizzes. Two essays also, and attendance checked every now and then with quiz. Got a B, but would definitely recommend him
This guy is the coolest! Such a smart guy, great lecturer, and very "chill". I'd give him 11/10. If you're taking Philosophy, TAKE PROF. YI'S CLASS!

I'm completely confused by all the "amazing" comments this professor is getting. Sure, he's handsome, and makes a few jokes here and there, but I don't think hes all that great a professor. Only two students seemed to get the material while everyone else was lost the entire semester. He's got the potential to be great in a few more years.

Prof. Yi is interesting, funny and good looking. He is fair in his tests and grading. Gives plenty of time for assignments and he explains dense subject matter very well. One of the best professors I have had at KSU. Defiantly take his class!

Mr. Yi is one of the best professors I have ever had. He truly wants you to pass & makes the content enjoyable. He loves helping & is excited when you're excited. Sweetest teacher at Kennesaw. He is easy ONLY because he is a good teacher and makes you excited to do well. If I wasn't graduating I would take him again.

He is a great teacher. He's really nice, and wants you to do well. He gives extra credit opportunities and you choose your papers. It's very easy to make an A as long as you do the work. He gives random quizzes that count for attendance grades. Definitely recommend him. Definitely buy the book.

Great professor, very intelligent and helpful. He's able to present difficult philosophical concepts in a very down-to-earth manner. Make sure you keep up with the readings and class should be interesting. Be warned, there may be no sign-in sheet but he does keep track of attendance.

This was a great class! The papers (2 out of 3 subjects) can be pretty tricky (he's very specific about what he wants) but the lectures were great! He is very engaging, uses powerpoints and the dry-erase board to help you visualize. He gives reading quizzes randomly in the first 5mins of class so keep on top of reading and don't be late.

Yes he's cute but you have to work hard in this class. If you miss any class, you miss alot of theories for the exam. His instructions are clear, papers are engaging and graded HARSHLY. Didn't receive graded papers until the end of the semester, so no guidance on direction. Tests are very hard and you have to study alot. If you work hard, he's okay

Wonderful, wonderful professor.  Always helpful and understanding.  Open to new ideas and perfectly explains every topic.  I STRONGLY suggest taking this professor!  He gives quizzes (2-3 questions) at the beginning of random classes so be sure to attend class if possible.  AWESOME teacher.  Loved this class.

Wonderful teacher. I was worried about taking the class because I was afraid it would be really confusing but professor Yi is very knowledgeable and willing to repeat things until everyone gets it. Reading for every class but only a couple of pages, occasional quizzes, and 2 papers. Tests look difficult but they're not bad. Definitely recommend!

Very engaging class! Friendly professor who wants all his students to participate in daily discussions and succeed. Only two tests(midterm and final) and lots of reading quizzes that count for attendance. Highly recommend him!

Excellent teacher! He loves what he does and wants you to do well.  He gives all the tools you need to get an A.  He was a refreshing change from some of the old burned out professors.  I didn't even want to take this class, but he made me want to go every day.  Can't say enough good things about him.
TAKE HIM! He is very nice and helpful, and great at teaching philosophy! He really knows his stuff, and teaches it very well.

TAKE HIM! He is nice, helpful, and a very, very good teacher. He has a good sense of humor and he explains the material and helps you out until you understand it. 6 quizes, 2 papers (easy), midterm, and final. I made an 'A'. This class was very interesting and I looked forward going to it everyday. Great professor, take him!

Yi is a great professor. You have six reading quizzes, but they are the easiest things imaginable. The only tests are the midterm and final,which he supplies a study guide for. You also have to write 2 papers. This class  sounds like a lot, but it has turned out to be really easy and even interesting. Great funny guy!

He lets students go on and on in discussion and in reviews, he wants the students to give definitions and explanations. It really got on my nerves that he wouldn't explain or answer review questions on his own. He's vague. He had our papers for over a month and did not grade them. According to track changes, he graded them the day he returned them.

Take this professor. He is a young and down to earth with a real passion for his subject. You are well prepared for all the work done in class and the reading is interesting. He gives you all the materiel you will need to pass and works with you. Show up and its not hard to get an A and enjoy this class.

Mr. Yi was so fun and down to Earth. Great teacher. If you read the material, (which is interesting) engage in lectures, and study for exams you will pass the A. He's fair and understands. Exactly what a philosophy teacher should be.

Professor Yi is new to KSU and did a good job of jumping in mid semester. He uses power points that are not available prior to class sessions. Choice of two out of four short papers to write. Takes grades on four out of six easy pop quizzes. Mid-term and final are challenging. Grades fairly and explains everything in great detail.
